definition: to disappear/to vanish/to eliminate/to spend (time)/have to/need
to protect/to defend/to guard against/to prevent
office/situation/classifier for games: match, set, round etc

sentences.english: Tens of thousands were stranded in other areas, the national fire service said, according to Reuters.
sentences.chinese: 據路透社報道，國家消防局說，好幾萬人身處險境。

sentences.english: New York's Fire Department said 78 people were injured.
sentences.chinese: 紐約消防局稱，有78人受傷。

sentences.english: 'The Police Department has a much better radio communications system than the Fire Department, ' Mr. Corbett said.
sentences.chinese: 科貝特說，“警察局的無線電就比消防局強得多。

sentences.english: Last Sunday, the headquarters of the Fire Department received a call from a village.
sentences.chinese: 上週日，消防局的指揮部接到來自一個鄉村的電話。

sentences.english: To get an update, we reached by phone the Shanghai Fire Prevention Bureau.
sentences.chinese: 爲了瞭解最新進展，我們撥通了上海消防局的電話。

sentences.english: My neighbour burn the small jungle beside my house, then have to call to BOMBA again.
sentences.chinese: 我的鄰居又燒草叢，結果又打電話給消防局。

sentences.english: This pulchritude hangs from the side wall of a bombard house.
sentences.chinese: 消防局的牆上掛着一面國旗。

definition: police station (abbr. for 警察署[jing3 cha2 shu3])
police department/police station/abbr. of 警察局
Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP), Canadian federal and national police force/Mounties
(Tw) San Diego, California/Santiago, capital of Chile
to receive a report/to receive intelligence, information etc
